The legendary Sun Tome was crafted long ago by a mage who preferred to spend her days roaming the desert. It was not her only tome of spells, but it was her favorite. In addition to her notes on desert travel and a handful of spells, she took the time to instill a few magic properties in the book itself.

The Sun Tome has the following properties:

  • Anyone who studies the book for an hour gains advantage on all intelligence (nature) and wisdom (survival) checks made in desert terrain for the following week.

  • It contains the following wizard spells: @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.7u2obDvuvtZBkTfq]{Scorching Ray}, @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.ztgcdrWPshKRpFd0]{Fireball}, @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.sTIkQK7KuQNOyY0C]{Hallucinatory Terrain}, @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.2RC0EyvBLPH88PZF]{Sunbeam}, @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.f38w5rd9SgdmWc6F]{Mirage Arcane}, and@Compendium[dnd5e.spells.hzK7FQya0BDjSmLE]{Sunburst}.

  • As long as you can see the sun at the beginning of your turn, you are immune to magical effects that would impair your vision (such as the Darkness spell, or a mummy lordâ€™s blinding dust ability).

  • As long as you hold the Sun Tome, you can cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.BP3GCwa66IAw1yTG]{Daylight} spell as if you had prepared it.

  • If you have a familiar, you can have it take on the form of a @Compendium[dnd5e.monsters.BUCfQ7ihaXX75Vai]{Dust Mephit} instead of its usual forms.
